result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Other Felony)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution in an amount to be determined at hearing on 1-7-2016 at 8:30 a.m.

01-07-2016-Judge Ellen R. Brostrom-- RESTITUTION HEARING PROCEEDED--State is requesting $11,821.59 in restitution. Defense argues the defendant's ability to pay. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $8,000.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation. Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.. Restitution to receive FIRST priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges and/or fines. Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment with tax intercept.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs and surcharges.
As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.
Consecutive to: consecutive to counts 2 and 3 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
Vocational/educational training.
No contact with victim, her family, their residence or places of employment.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: consecutive to counts 1 and 3 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.
Consecutive to: consecutive to counts 1 and 2 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.

IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

per order dated April 29, 2020, Appeal No. 2020AP000210 W, IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Defendant Derrick D Brown in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Derrick D Brown in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

RESTITUTION HEARING PROCEEDED:  Sworn for the State:  Sharon Dosch (WI. Dept. of Justice Crime Victim Compensation Program).  EXhibits 1 & 2 are marked, offered by State and received by the courts.  Cross examination.

State is request court orders $11,821.59 in restitution.  Defense argues the defendant's ability to pay.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $8,000.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment with tax intercept.

Defendant Derrick D Brown in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Derrick D Brown in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant's motion to dismiss and motion notwithstanding verdict argued by counsel and denied by the court.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS  consecutive to counts 2 and 3 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS  consecutive to counts 1 and 3 and  any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6.5 YEARS  consecutive to counts 1 and 2 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

As to each count: Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety
*Random urine screens.
*No contact with victim, her family, their residence or places of employment
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Restitution in an amount to be determined
*Pay all costs and surcharges

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.
  
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Case adjourned to 1-7-2016 at 8:30 a.m. for restitution hearing in Branch 6. 

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

On motion of the State, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-22-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Jury in the box at 1:28 p.m.  Sworn for the State: Michelle Burns and Milwaukee Police Detective Tammy Tramel-McCain.  State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury out of the box at 2:36 p.m.  Exhibits 1 through 6, 8 through 36, 45, 46, 49 through 53, 55, 59, 64 and 74 offered and received into evidence.  Defendant examined as to his right to testify.  Court finds defendant freely voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to testify.  Filed signed Waiver of Right to Testify.  Court takes a short break.  Jury instructions and verdicts finalized.  Jury in the box at 3:45 p.m.  Defendant rests.  State rests. Testimony closed.  Court instructs the jury.  Jury out of the box at 4:06 p.m.  Case adjourned to 6-3-2015 at 9:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant Derrick D Brown in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Derrick D Brown in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's motion to exclude exhibits 47, 47, 60 and 61 argued by counsel and granted by the court.  Jury in the box at 10:04 a.m.  Sworn for the State: Shanette F., Keith S., Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Wagner, Milwaukee Police Detective Victor Centeno, Milwaukee Police Detective Steve Wells, Milwaukee Police Officer Kranz and Milwaukee Police Detective Tammy Tramel-McClain.  Jury out of the box at 11:09 a.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 11:31 a.m.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Matthew Stadler and Milwaukee Police Detective Rodney Gonzales.  Jury out of the box 11:48 a.m.  Court breaks for lunch.

Jury in the box at 3:12 p.m.   Jury sworn.  Court gives preliminary instructions to the jury.  Opening statements made by Attorneys Kevin Shomin and Douglas Bihler.  Sworn for the State: A.J.  Jury out of the box at 4:51 p.m. Case adjourned to 6-1-2015 at 9:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Jury in the box at 1:36 p.m.  Voir dire continued.  Parties thereupon proceeded to impanel a jury.  Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled case and who were duly impaneled.  Jury list, in writing, received and filed.  Jury out of the box at 2:49 p.m.  Court takes a short break.

Defendant Derrick D Brown in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Derrick D Brown in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant motions and then withdraws motion that Attorney Bihler to withdraw withdrawn by the defendant.  Jury panel in the box.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:43 a.m. Jury out of the box at 11:52 a.m.  Court breaks for lunch.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Final pretrial conference held.  State's offer put on the record.  Defendant rejects State's offer. Court informs parties all offers are off the table.  Case remains calendared on 6-1-2015 at 10:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.
